definition: Cain (name)/Cain (biblical character), a figure of Judeo-Christian-Muslim mythology
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
secret/hidden/concealed/(prefix) crypto-
to lean upon

sentences.english: The seventh from Adam in Cain's line was Lamech.
sentences.chinese: 從亞當始，該隱的家系中第七世孫命叫拉麥。

sentences.english: If anyone kills Cain, Cain shall be avenged sevenfold.
sentences.chinese: 任何人如果殺了該隱，該隱可以七倍奉還。

sentences.english: Rather, He knew that Cain's offering was masking an unrighteous attitude.
sentences.chinese: 只是，祂知道該隱的供物隱藏着不義的態度。

sentences.english: Cain and Abel, Linus and Lucy, Liam and Noel.
sentences.chinese: 該隱和亞伯，萊納斯和露西，里昂和諾埃爾。

sentences.english: The Bible doesn't mention any of Cain's sisters.
sentences.chinese: 《聖經》沒有提及任何有關該隱姐妹的事。

sentences.english: Of Cain awoke all that woful breed.
sentences.chinese: 該隱醒來一切可憫可悲的品種。

sentences.english: God warned him that sin was waiting at the door of his life, looking for an opportunity to enter.
sentences.chinese: 神警示該隱，罪惡已等在生命的門口，伺機進入。

sentences.english: “Cain” was the name of a biblical man and a place.
sentences.chinese: “該隱”是一個聖經人物的名字，也是一個地名。

sentences.english: Cain wandered until he found Lilith by the Red Sea.
sentences.chinese: 該隱一直流亡着，直到他在紅海找到了莉莉絲。

sentences.english: Kain, Gibeah and Timnah--ten towns and their villages.
sentences.chinese: 該隱，基比亞，亭納，共十座城，還有屬城的村莊。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

trivial matter/a piece of cake
female gossip/busybody

to behave unscrupulously

sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
comic monologue/one-person comic sketch
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
